intro: Angolluma sheilae, commonly known as the Sheilas' angolluma, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and leathery, oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to low rainfall conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
